story.title: Hot for Prof - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Holly Miller has just made the sexiest mistake of her life‚Ä¶or is it a mistake at all?
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: OMG Alice‚ÄîGUESS who walked into my Civil War Generals class?
It‚Äôs bad.
Who?
I literally have my head ducked down below the seat in front of me.
Holly Miller, tell me. WHO is it?
It‚Äôs LIONEL.
WHAT??!!!
The guy from the bar last night?
The one who gave us that tip about Swish Nightclub?
The one you SLEPT with??!!
Yeah. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
This isn‚Äôt that bad, Hol.
I know you‚Äôre not a one-night-stand kind of girl, so it might be weird, but‚Ä¶
Maybe you guys can start something.
He was cute, wasn‚Äôt he?
I say you flag him down‚Äîask him to sit next to you.
Can‚Äôt really do that.
Why not?
Is he already sitting next to a girl?
No‚Ä¶
He‚Äôs standing in front of the class.
Doing what?
HOLY SHIT.
This is a joke, right?
Nope. It‚Äôs real.
He‚Äôs the professor.
You gotta get out of there.
Just run out the back.
He might see you for a second‚Ä¶
But at least it‚Äôd be over and you‚Äôd be free of him.
I‚Äôm not leaving. This is Civil War Generals.
I‚Äôve been trying to get into this class for years.
Quit being such a nerd and LEAVE.
Join my History of Modern Art class instead. It‚Äôs safe ‚Äì no hot profs here.
Just this sexy bitch:
Alice, you know that‚Äôs not an option.
You can make fun of me for being a nerd all you want‚Ä¶
But it‚Äôs not going to change the fact that I care about school.
ü§ì
Jk lol
No time for that‚Äînow he‚Äôs taking attendance.
I gotta go.
I‚Äôll have the Ben & Jerry‚Äôs ready for you when you get back to our dorm.
Thanks roomie. I‚Äôm gonna need it.
Somewhere in the middle of the C last names, Lionel and Holly finally lock eyes,
But his face is completely blank.
And that‚Äôs when Holly realizes there‚Äôs something worse than sleeping with your professor.
It‚Äôs when your professor doesn‚Äôt recognize you EVEN THOUGH you‚Äôve slept with him.
Her mouth goes dry, but Holly forces herself to raise her hand.
When Lionel doesn‚Äôt call on her, she speaks up.
Professor?
Please save all questions for the end.
But, sir, it‚Äôs personal.
If that‚Äôs the case, then perhaps it would be better if we met after class.
There‚Äôs a beat of silence before Lionel speaks again.
Now, can I continue with my introduction to the class?
Y-yes.
Holly‚Äôs face burns for the next 45 minutes, and she can‚Äôt register a thing Lionel says.
When class is finally over, she approaches his desk, where a small group of students is gathered.
Lionel ignores Holly once again as he deals with their questions quickly and succinctly.
When everyone else has left, he turns to her.
I think you and I should go to my office.
I think you‚Äôre probably right.
Once they‚Äôre inside the office and Lionel shuts the door,
It‚Äôs as if everything is on fire.
Holly is drawn to Lionel‚Äîperhaps because she can‚Äôt have him,
Or perhaps it‚Äôs because there‚Äôs something wonderful and magical between them.
She inches toward him, hungry for his lips.
Holly, you‚Äôre killing me.
We can‚Äôt.
We have to talk about our situation.
But there isn‚Äôt really a solution to it, is there?
So, your plan is just to move ahead, full throttle?!
Yes.
Ugh, I mean, no.
I don‚Äôt know‚Äîwe could hide it, right?
I don‚Äôt think I can.
I‚Äôm too attracted to you, Holly.
God, I don‚Äôt know how to teach with you sitting out there in my class.
I couldn‚Äôt even say your name today.
Did you notice how I stopped calling the attendance when I realized you were there?
No‚Äîit was hard for me to concentrate
So I didn‚Äôt really take in what you were saying.
But damn it! This is my education. I really want to take this class.
It‚Äôs my RIGHT to take this class.
Yes, I know. And it‚Äôs important to me that you get that right.
But you‚Äôre not really taking the class if you‚Äôre not concentrating, are you?
No‚Ä¶
Look, I‚Äôm not gonna stop you from enrolling.
But here‚Äôs what I propose we do‚Ä¶
We come clean to the board.
Then I arrange for you to follow the syllabus as an independent study with another professor.
Have you had Foser?
No.
Wait, Foser?
My roommate has her‚Äîfor History of Modern Art.
Yeah, so isn‚Äôt that a logical jump?
Since this class is Postmodernism in America‚Ä¶?
Relief washes over Holly so suddenly that she bursts into laughter.
Holly, this really isn‚Äôt funny.
Yes it is, Lionel--I went to the wrong class!
I‚Äôm not your student.
I never will be.
I don‚Äôt have an artistic bone in my body.
What? I don‚Äôt understand.
I‚Äôm a History major.
When I saw you in class today, I thought you were teaching Civil War Generals.
You‚Äôre not in my class?
No.
In that case, I‚Äôve always wanted to do this‚Ä¶
In one fluid motion, Lionel wipes all the books and papers off his desk.
They burst into a fit of giggles--but when Lionel draws Holly in his arms‚Ä¶
The heat between them is undeniable.
He lays her down on the table and they look into each other‚Äôs eyes.
But before Lionel‚Äôs lips touch Holly‚Äôs, he whispers to her softly.
Holly?
Class or no class, this isn‚Äôt going to be an easy relationship.
You‚Äôre still a student, and I‚Äôm still a professor.
But what we had last night‚Ä¶
I haven‚Äôt had that kind of connection in a very long time.
And I hope that for you‚Äî
You don‚Äôt have to finish that sentence. I want you.
I want this.
Well, I want you to be my girlfriend, Holly.
Can we make this real?
Lionel searches Holly‚Äôs eyes,
As she falls deeper into the suede blue depths of his irises.
Yes.
Oh God, Lionel, Yes.
Now kiss me, because it feels like I‚Äôm on fire.
And he does‚Äîbut their lust consumes them anyway.
